intro: Cynanchum schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian milkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, which are pollinated by insects. Its latex contains milky sap, which is a distinguishing feature of the genus Cynanchum. This plant is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, thriving in regions with moderate rainfall.
